Uses of Interface
xxl.core.util.Decorator

  • Packages that use Decorator 
    Package Description
    xxl.core.collections
    Contains an alternative collections framework and miscellaneous utility classes to handle with the Java collections framework.
    xxl.core.collections.bags
    Contains some bags.
    xxl.core.collections.containers
    Provides some containers.
    xxl.core.collections.queues
    The package xxl.core.collections.queues provides miscellaneous implementations of the queue datastructure.
    xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas
    This package provides so-called SweepAreas.
    xxl.core.cursors
    The package xxl.core.cursors provides a whole algebra of cursors that extends the functionality of the classes Iterator and Enumeration.
    xxl.core.cursors.identities
    The package xxl.core.cursors.identities provides miscellaneous implementations of identity operators on cursors.
    xxl.core.cursors.wrappers
    The package xxl.core.cursors.wrappers provides miscellaneous implementations of wrapper classes that make an object representing an arbitrary form of iteration via the cursor interface.
    xxl.core.functions
    Functions are an extremely important concept to encapsulate abstractions.
    xxl.core.io.raw
    Contains classes and interfaces to access raw devices (disks) directly.
    xxl.core.math.functions
    The package xxl.core.math.functions contains necessary classes and interfaces to work with real-valued functions.
    xxl.core.predicates
    This package provides Predicates.
    xxl.core.relational.metaData
    This package provides the classes that are needed for describing the metadata of the relational algebra operators.
    xxl.core.relational.resultSets  

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.collections

      Classes in xxl.core.collections that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CountingComparator<T> 
      class  DecoratorComparator<T> 
      class  DecoratorList<T> 
      class  DecoratorSet<T> 
      class  DecoratorSortedSet<T> 

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.collections.bags

      Classes in xxl.core.collections.bags that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DecoratorBag<E>
      The class provides a decorator for a bag that follows the Decorator Design Pattern (for further details see Structural Patterns, Decorator in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides).
      class  UnmodifiableBag
      This class provides a decorator for a given bag that cannot be modified.

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.collections.containers

      Classes in xxl.core.collections.containers that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DecoratorContainer
      The class provides a decorator for a container that follows the Decorator Design Pattern (for further details see Structural Patterns, Decorator in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides).

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.collections.queues

      Classes in xxl.core.collections.queues that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractMemoryManageableQueue<E> 
      class  BoundedQueue<E>
      Decorates an arbitrary queue by adding boundary conditions.
      class  DecoratorQueue<E>
      This class provides a decorator for a queue that follows the Decorator Design Pattern (for further details see Structural Patterns, Decorator in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides).
      class  DistinctQueue<E>
      This class provides a wrapper for a queue that performes a simple duplicate elimination.
      class  MemoryManageableListQueue<E> 
      class  ThreadsafeQueue<E>
      A ThreadsafeQueue can be used by different threads that use this queue for communicating with each other.
      class  UnmodifiableQueue<E>
      This class provides a decorator for a given queue that cannot be modified.

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas

      Classes in xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CountingSweepArea<I,E> 
      class  DecoratorSweepArea<I,E> 
      class  DefaultMemoryManageableSA<I,E>
      Default implementation for a memory manageable SweepArea.
      class  MemoryManageableSA<I,E>
      This abstract class decorates a SweepArea to make it memory manageable.

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.cursors

      Classes in xxl.core.cursors that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DecoratorCursor<E>
      This class decorates an object implementing the interface Cursor such that all method calls on the decorator are passed to its decorated object.

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.cursors.identities

      Classes in xxl.core.cursors.identities that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  LoggingMetaDataCursor
      This class decorates a cursor or a metadata-cursor passing by all its method calls while writing logging information to a print-stream.

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.cursors.wrappers

      Classes in xxl.core.cursors.wrappers that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AutomaticCloseCursor 

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.functions

      Classes in xxl.core.functions that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CMDFunction<P,R,I,M>
      This class provides a CMDFunction (= CompositeMetaDataFunction).
      class  CountingFunction<P,R>
      A DecoratorFunction that provides additional information about the number of function calls its inner function.
      class  DecoratorFunction<P,R>
      A decorator-function decorates (wraps) a function by passing given arguments to the invoke method of the wrapped function.
      class  For<P,R>
      A (recursive) functional for-loop.
      class  FunctionMetaDataFunction<P,R,M>
      This class provides a skeleton implementation based upon the DecoratorFunction for functions providing meta data.
      class  Swapper<P,R>
      A Swapper decorates (wraps) a Function and swaps arguments when calling invoke(argument0, argument1) if demanded by the user or a given predicate.

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.io.raw

      Classes in xxl.core.io.raw that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DecoratorRawAccess
      Decorates a RawAccess.
      class  SeekMapperRawAccess
      If you have a big hard drive and only relatively small data, then possibly all data is on the same physical cylinder.
      class  TesterRawAccess
      Tests a RawAccess by writing the data to a second control raw access.

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.math.functions

      Classes in xxl.core.math.functions that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CountingAggregationFunction<P,A> 
      class  DecoratorAggregationFunction<P,A>
      A decorator-aggregation-function decorates (wraps) an aggregation-function by passing given arguments to the invoke method of the wrapped aggregation-function.
      class  DistinctAggregationFunction<P,A>
      This class realizes an aggregation-function performing an early duplicate elimination during an aggregate operation.
      class  DistinctMetaDataAggregationFunction<P,A,M>
      This class realizes a metadata aggregation-function performing an early duplicate elimination during an aggregate operation.
      class  MetaDataAggregationFunction<P,A,M>
      Decorates a given aggregation function with metadata information.

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.predicates

      Classes in xxl.core.predicates that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CountingPredicate<P>
      A DecoratorPredicate that provides additional information about calls, hits, and misses to its inner predicate.
      class  DecoratorPredicate<P>
      The class provides a decorator for a predicate that follows the Decorator Design Pattern (for further details see Structural Patterns, Decorator in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides).
      class  LeftBind<P>
      This class provides a binary predicate which left (first) argument is bound to a constant object.
      class  Not<P>
      This class provides a logical NOT predicate.
      class  PredicateMetaDataPredicate<P,M>
      This abstract class provides a wrapper for a given predicate that provides additional meta data.
      class  RightBind<P>
      This class provides a binary predicate which right (second) argument is bound to a constant object.

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.relational.metaData

      Classes in xxl.core.relational.metaData that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DecoratorColumnMetaData
      This class provides a decorator for a result set's column metadata.
      class  RenamedColumnMetaData
      Makes a renaming of a result set's column metadata.

    • Uses of Decorator in xxl.core.relational.resultSets

      Classes in xxl.core.relational.resultSets that implement Decorator 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DecoratorResultSet
      This class decorates a result set.
      class  VirtualTable
      This class is a wrapper for result sets with the intention to receive an instance of the VTI (Virtual Table Interface) in order to use the wrapped result set in a FROM clause of an SQL-J statement.
